item.title: Web
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Web - HTML Web Introduction HTML/CSS Introduction CSS and HTML are the core languages used for creating web pages and web-based applications. HTML was invnted in 1989, while CSS was invented in 1996. HTML stand for HyperText Markup Language is a markup language for creating the structure and content of a webpage using text, images, links, and containers. Meanwhile CSS, or Cascading Style Sheets, is used to modify the design and display of those HTML elements.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: SQL
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: SQL - Quering Data What is SQL? What is SQL? SQL stands for Structured Query Language. It’s a query language - a type of language that lets one interact with a database. One use queries to do so. Example: 1 SELECT * FROM users; The query above return all the rows and columns from the users table. Why Learn SQL? Many argue that SQL is the most useful technical skill to learn in general.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: Security
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Security - Application Security Intro to AppSec What is AppSec? AppSec (short for Application security) is simply a set of measures taken to improve the security of an application. This is often done by finding, fixing, and preventing security culnerabilities. There have been many data breaches since the beginning of the internet, and they now represent the main reason for govermments creating data protection regulations. In 2019, Veracode reported that more than 80% of webapps have at least one security flaw.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: Python
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Python - Core Meet Python Python Intro Python is a popular high-level programming language. That means it’s designed to be easy to read, using English keywords and simple syntax. For example, here’s how one might check whether a number is greater than another number: 1 2 3 4 5 6 my_age = 23 legal_age = 21 if my_age >= legal_age: print("You can have a beer!") else: print("Unlucky.") Python is also a general-purpose programming language.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: JavaScript
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: JavaScript - Core Introduction JavaScript Why Learn JavaScript? JavaScript was originally developed to add functionality to web pages but it’s now used for much more! Some reason to start with JavaScript: JavaScript runs on much any platform from web pages, to server backends and even hardware There are some great build and deployment tools and frameworks written in JavaScript that are useful in many applications It’s great introduction to functional programming concepts All one need to write JavaScript is a simple text editor High demand for JavaScript developers JavaScript is easy to learn.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: Java
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Java - Fundamentals Introduction to Java Java is a programming language that follows the Object-oriented programming paradigm (OOP) It was first released in 1995 by Sun Microsystems, and has since grown to be one of the most used programming languages. The fact that it’s still one of the most-used languages over 25 years later shows how durable it is. Java is a secure, and portable language. Why Learn Java? Reasons to learn Java:
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: Go
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Go - Introduction Introduction Meet Go Go is a statically typed, fast compiled, and open-source language designed by Google. Common name for Go is Golang because of the website of golang.org. the domain name go.org wasn’t available when the language was created. Golang was created because the developers at Google wanted to make a new language that supports modern multicore machines and large codebases. The design of Golang aims to have the readability and usability of JavaScript or Python while also having great performance with multiprocessing CPUs and networking.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: Data Analysis
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Data Analysis - Core Intro What is Data Analysis? Data analysis is the method of discovering useful information from data. The process involves collecting, organizing, exploring and drawing conclusions from data. Broadly speaking, one can think of data analysis as translating numbers into meaningful words Data analysis is all around - just think about how Netflix chooses which movies to display, and what appears on Instagram newsfeed. Walmart uses data analysis to figure out what to stock.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: Coding Intro
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Coding Intro - Core Introduction Intro to Coding If one want to learn to code here one can get started. Here will be covered the core features everyone yould know before starting to program. Here will be emphasize key themes and tools that be useful. All programming languages have a handful of building blocks. When combined, they can create any program: variables - where data is stored data types - how to tell what’s a number or what’s text functions - how one can organize commands conditions - how to make yes/no decisions loops - how to repeat behavior Every concept, feature, technology, or best practice beyond these basic building blocks were invented to help mere humans manage the complexity of larger programs.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE

item.title: What is Git
item.author: contact@perezre.de (PEREZRE)
item.description: Git - Essentials What is Git? Git is standard of version control. It’s the most commercial (and open-source) projects ust to keep track versions of their products. It was developed by Linux Torvalds Why Git? Before Git things you had to Get all previous changes from the central server. Edit the files and make sure they work. Send all the changes to the central server. Now with Git, every developer can have their own copy of the project.
item.dc:creator: PEREZRE
